ul.li1: 201 Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler,
ul.li2: and any who go astray by it are not wise.
ul.li1: 2Roaring like the lion is the dreaded anger of a king;
ul.li2: he who provokes him forfeits his life.Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 3It is honorable for the man to refrain from strife,
ul.li2: but every fool will be quick to quarrel.
ul.li1: 4The lazy person will not plow in season;
ul.li2: he will expect at the harvest, but there will be nothing.
ul.li1: 5Deep waters are like purpose in the heartOr “mind” of a man,
ul.li2: and a man of understanding will draw itOr “her”; referring to “purpose” out.
ul.li1: 6Many a person will proclaim his loyalty for himself,
ul.li2: but a man who is trustworthy, who can find?
ul.li1: 7He who walks in his integrity is righteous;
ul.li2: happy are his children who follow him.
ul.li1: 8A king who sits on the throne of judgment
ul.li2: winnows all evil with his eyes.
ul.li1: 9Who will say “I have made my heartOr “mind” clean;
ul.li2: I am pure from my sin”?
ul.li1: 10Stone and stone, measure and measure,
ul.li2: both of themLiterally “also the two of them” are an abomination of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 11Even by his acts, a young manOr “young boy,” or “adolescent” will make himself known,
ul.li2: whether his acts are pure and upright.
ul.li1: 12The ear that hears and the eye that sees,
ul.li2: Yahweh has made them both.Literally “also the two of them”
ul.li1: 13Do not love sleep, lest you become poor;
ul.li2: open your eyes and have plenty bread.
ul.li1: 14“Bad, bad,” the buyer will say,
ul.li2: but when one goes to him, then he will boast.
ul.li1: 15There is gold and many costly stones,
ul.li2: but precious jewels are lips of knowledge.
ul.li1: 16Take his garment, for he has given security to a stranger,
ul.li2: and on behalf of a foreigner—take it as pledge.
ul.li1: 17Bread gained by deceit is sweet for the man,
ul.li2: but afterward, his mouth will be filled with gravel.
ul.li1: 18A planHebrew “plans” will be established by advice,
ul.li2: and with guidance make war.
ul.li1: 19He reveals a secret, he who walks about with gossip,
ul.li2: and do not associate with a babbler’s lips.
ul.li1: 20He who curses his father and his mother,
ul.li2: his lamp will be extinguished in the midst of darkness.Literally “in a pupil of darkness”
ul.li1: 21An inheritance acquired hastily at the beginningLiterally “at the first”
ul.li2: will not be blessed at its end.
ul.li1: 22Do not say “I will repay evil”;
ul.li2: wait for Yahweh and he will deliver you.
ul.li1: 23An abomination of Yahweh is a stone and a weight,Literally “a stone and a stone”
ul.li2: and scales of falsehood are not good.
ul.li1: 24Away from Yahweh are the steps of a strong man,
ul.li2: and how will humankind understand his ways?
ul.li1: 25It is a snare to humankind to say rashly “It is holy,”
ul.li2: and after vows, to scrutinize.
ul.li1: 26A wise king winnows the wicked,
ul.li2: and he will drive a wheel over them.
ul.li1: 27The lamp of Yahweh is the spiritOr “soul” of humankind,
ul.li2: he who searches every innermost part.Literally “parts of the inmost”
ul.li1: 28Loyalty and faithfulness will preserve a king,
ul.li2: and he is upheld with the righteousness of his throne.
ul.li1: 29The glory of young men is their strength,Or “strengthens them”
ul.li2: but the beauty of the aged is gray hair.
ul.li1: 30The blows of a wound will cleanse evil,
ul.li2: as willHebrew “and” beatings of the innermost part.Literally “parts of the inmost”
